clean_text: In fact, several visions co-exist. In the business- as-usual scenario, blue growth revolves around maximising economic growth derived from marine and aquatic resources. The latter is possible only if a genuine effort of inclusiveness is made towards small-scale actors from the very beginning. clean_text: Since disclosure regarding environmental impacts is not mandatory, many important multinational enterprises manage to get away with it. The Disclosure Insight Action Coalition issued a communique on 17June 2019 reflecting the position of 88 investors representing US$ 10 trillion assets. They were targeting 707 companies with a high environmental impact and a US$ 15.3 trillion market capitalisation for not reporting their climate change, water security and deforestation data. The most targeted industry for climate change disclosure were the services industry, followed by manufacturing and fossil fuels. For water security, the most targeted industries were manufacturing, retail and fossil fuels, and for deforestation, the retail, food, beverage and agriculture and manufacturing industries.
raw_text: Since disclosure regarding environmental impacts is not mandatory, many important multinational enterprises (MNEs) manage to get away with it. The Disclosure Insight Action Coalition (CDP, former Carbon Disclosure Project) issued a communique on 17June 2019 reflecting the position of 88 investors representing US$ 10 trillion assets. They were targeting 707 companies with a high environmental impact and a US$ 15.3 trillion market capitalisation for not reporting their climate change, water security and deforestation data (CDP, 2019). The most targeted industry for climate change disclosure were the services industry (27% of all companies), followed by manufacturing (18%) and fossil fuels (12%). For water security, the most targeted industries were manufacturing (26%), retail (23%) and fossil fuels (11%), and for deforestation, the retail (30%), food, beverage and agriculture (26%) and manufacturing (16%) industries.

sentences.text: Since disclosure regarding environmental impacts is not mandatory, many important multinational enterprises manage to get away with it.
The Disclosure Insight Action Coalition issued a communique on 17June 2019 reflecting the position of 88 investors representing US$ 10 trillion assets.
They were targeting 707 companies with a high environmental impact and a US$ 15.3 trillion market capitalisation for not reporting their climate change, water security and deforestation data.
The most targeted industry for climate change disclosure were the services industry, followed by manufacturing and fossil fuels.
For water security, the most targeted industries were manufacturing, retail and fossil fuels, and for deforestation, the retail, food, beverage and agriculture and manufacturing industries.

clean_text: Beyond MNEs closely scrutinised by investors or exposed to reputational risk, it is difficult to estimate how many companies, even multinational, go under the radar when it comes to sustainability. In a policy report dated May 2018, OECD points at the limited data available regarding the number of MNEs in the world. The most recent figure on the number of non-financial transnational corporations was 82,000 in 2010 according to UNCTAD. In 2017, the World Bank reported a total of 43,146 listed domestic companies in the world, while 125 million formal MSME were reported in the Country Indicators of 132 economies in August 2010, including 89 million in emerging markets.
raw_text: Beyond MNEs closely scrutinised by investors or exposed to reputational risk, it is difficult to estimate how many companies, even multinational, go under the radar when it comes to sustainability. In a policy report dated May 2018, OECD points at the limited data available regarding the number of MNEs in the world (OECD, 2018). The most recent figure on the number of non-financial transnational corporations was 82,000 in 2010 according to UNCTAD (2009). In 2017, the World Bank reported a total of 43,146 listed domestic companies in the world (World Bank, n.d.a), while 125 million formal MSME (micro, small and medium enterprise) were reported in the Country Indicators of 132 economies in August 2010, including 89 million in emerging markets (Kushnir et al., 2010).

sentences.text: Beyond MNEs closely scrutinised by investors or exposed to reputational risk, it is difficult to estimate how many companies, even multinational, go under the radar when it comes to sustainability.
In a policy report dated May 2018, OECD points at the limited data available regarding the number of MNEs in the world.
The most recent figure on the number of non-financial transnational corporations was 82,000 in 2010 according to UNCTAD.

In 2017, the World Bank reported a total of 43,146 listed domestic companies in the world, while 125 million formal MSME were reported in the Country Indicators of 132 economies in August 2010, including 89 million in emerging markets.

clean_text: 32.5% of the total value of the facilities was provided to companies involved in the exploitation of oil and gas, and 27% of that same value was lent to power generation companies.
